Named Products¶

Named infinite products arise throughout the theory of modular forms and \(q\)-series. The generalized eta product \((q^b;q^t)_\infty\) is the building block; the Jacobi triple product, quintuple product, and Winquist product are classical compositions of eta products.

q_kangaroo.etaq(session, b, t, order)¶

Compute the generalized eta product \((q^b; q^t)_\infty\).

Evaluates the infinite product \(\prod_{k=0}^{\infty}(1 - q^{b + kt})\). When \(b = t\), this gives \((q^t; q^t)_\infty\), related to the Dedekind eta function \(\eta(\tau) = q^{1/24} (q;q)_\infty\).

Parameters:

  • session (QSession) – The computation session.

  • b (int) – Starting exponent. Must be positive.

  • t (int) – Step size. Must be positive.

  • order (int) – Truncation order for the resulting series.

Returns:

The infinite product as a formal power series truncated to \(O(q^{\text{order}})\).

Return type:

QSeries

Raises:

ValueError – If b or t is not positive.

Examples

>>> from q_kangaroo import QSession, etaq
>>> s = QSession()
>>> euler = etaq(s, 1, 1, 20)  # (q;q)_inf = Euler function
>>> eta5 = etaq(s, 1, 5, 20)   # (q;q^5)_inf

See also

aqprod

General q-Pochhammer symbol \((a;q)_n\).

jacprod

Jacobi triple product JAC(a, b).

q_kangaroo.jacprod(session, a, b, order)¶

Compute the Jacobi triple product \(\text{JAC}(a, b)\).

Evaluates the three-factor product \(\text{JAC}(a,b) = (q^a; q^b)_\infty \cdot (q^{b-a}; q^b)_\infty \cdot (q^b; q^b)_\infty\). Requires \(0 < a < b\).

Parameters:

  • session (QSession) – The computation session.

  • a (int) – First exponent. Must satisfy \(0 < a < b\).

  • b (int) – Period. Must satisfy \(b > a > 0\).

  • order (int) – Truncation order for the resulting series.

Returns:

The Jacobi triple product as a formal power series.

Return type:

QSeries

Raises:

ValueError – If a and b do not satisfy \(0 < a < b\).

Examples

>>> from q_kangaroo import QSession, jacprod
>>> s = QSession()
>>> j = jacprod(s, 1, 5, 20)  # JAC(1, 5)

See also

etaq

Generalized eta product.

tripleprod

Jacobi triple product with monomial parameter.

q_kangaroo.tripleprod(session, coeff_num, coeff_den, power, order)¶

Compute the Jacobi triple product with monomial parameter \(z\).

Evaluates \((z; q)_\infty \cdot (q/z; q)_\infty \cdot (q; q)_\infty\) where \(z = \frac{\text{coeff\_num}}{\text{coeff\_den}} \cdot q^{\text{power}}\).

Parameters:

  • session (QSession) – The computation session.

  • coeff_num (int) – Numerator of the monomial coefficient for \(z\).

  • coeff_den (int) – Denominator of the monomial coefficient for \(z\).

  • power (int) – Power of \(q\) in the monomial \(z\).

  • order (int) – Truncation order for the resulting series.

Returns:

The triple product as a formal power series.

Return type:

QSeries

Examples

>>> from q_kangaroo import QSession, tripleprod
>>> s = QSession()
>>> tp = tripleprod(s, 1, 1, 1, 20)  # z = q

See also

jacprod

Jacobi triple product JAC(a, b) with integer parameters.

quinprod

Quintuple product identity.

q_kangaroo.quinprod(session, coeff_num, coeff_den, power, order)¶

Compute the quintuple product with monomial parameter \(z\).

Evaluates the five-factor quintuple product identity with \(z = \frac{\text{coeff\_num}}{\text{coeff\_den}} \cdot q^{\text{power}}\).

Parameters:

  • session (QSession) – The computation session.

  • coeff_num (int) – Numerator of the monomial coefficient for \(z\).

  • coeff_den (int) – Denominator of the monomial coefficient for \(z\).

  • power (int) – Power of \(q\) in the monomial \(z\).

  • order (int) – Truncation order for the resulting series.

Returns:

The quintuple product as a formal power series.

Return type:

QSeries

Examples

>>> from q_kangaroo import QSession, quinprod
>>> s = QSession()
>>> qp = quinprod(s, 1, 1, 1, 20)  # z = q

See also

tripleprod

Jacobi triple product.

winquist

Winquist’s identity product.

q_kangaroo.winquist(session, a_cn, a_cd, a_p, b_cn, b_cd, b_p, order)¶

Compute Winquist’s identity product with two monomial parameters \(a\) and \(b\).

Evaluates the 10-factor product from Winquist’s identity, where \(a = \frac{a\_cn}{a\_cd} \cdot q^{a\_p}\) and \(b = \frac{b\_cn}{b\_cd} \cdot q^{b\_p}\).

Parameters:

  • session (QSession) – The computation session.

  • a_cn (int) – Numerator of the coefficient for monomial \(a\).

  • a_cd (int) – Denominator of the coefficient for monomial \(a\).

  • a_p (int) – Power of \(q\) in monomial \(a\).

  • b_cn (int) – Numerator of the coefficient for monomial \(b\).

  • b_cd (int) – Denominator of the coefficient for monomial \(b\).

  • b_p (int) – Power of \(q\) in monomial \(b\).

  • order (int) – Truncation order for the resulting series.

Returns:

The Winquist product as a formal power series.

Return type:

QSeries

Examples

>>> from q_kangaroo import QSession, winquist
>>> s = QSession()
>>> w = winquist(s, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 20)

See also

quinprod

Quintuple product identity.

tripleprod

Jacobi triple product.
